title: PM Modi at Maha Kumbh Mela, takes holy dip at Triveni Sangam

India World Movies Sport Data Health Opinion Science Delhi Elections Premium Videos Podcast Photos Crossword Newsletter Events Lit for Life The Huddle Home News India Maha Kumbh: PM Modi takes holy dip at Sangam Copy link Email Facebook Twitter Telegram LinkedIn WhatsApp Reddit READ LATER Remove SEE ALL PRINT Watch: Modi visits Maha kumbh, takes holy dip at Sangam Dressed in a full-sleeve deep orange jersey and blue lowers, Mr. Modi held ‘rudraksh’ beads in his hands during the bathing ritual amid chants of mantras. Updated - February 05, 2025 12:52 pm IST - Mahakumbh Nagar PTI Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday (February 5, 2025) visited the Maha Kumbh Mela and took a holy dip at the Triveni Sangam. Maha Kumbh: A confluence of faith and culture Dressed in a full-sleeve deep orange jersey and blue lowers, Mr. Modi held ‘rudraksh’ beads in his hands during the bathing ritual amid chants of mantras. Prime Minister Narendra Modi takes dip at the Triveni Sangam | Photo Credit: X/@narendramodi The Prime Minister, who was wearing a ‘rudraksh’ necklace, offered prayers to the Sun and River Ganga. Mr. Modi took a boat ride from Arail Ghat to the Triveni Sangam -- the confluence of Ganga, Yamuna and the mythical Saraswati.He was accompanied by Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath accompanying Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the Triveni Sangam. | Photo Credit: PMO India Mr. Adityanath earlier welcomed the PM upon his arrival in Prayagraj. Two crore take ‘Amrit Snan’ on Basant Panchami without hitch at Maha Kumbh Being held after 12 years, the Maha Kumbh started on January 13 and will continue till February 26. It is considered among the holiest pilgrimages by Hindus The mega fair on the banks of the Sangam has been drawing millions of pilgrims from across India and the world. According to the Uttar Pradesh government, so far, over 38 crore pilgrims have visited the Maha Kumbh. Victims' Bodies Thrown In River": Jaya Bachchan Sparks Row "Kumbh Stampede Victims' Bodies Thrown In River": Jaya Bachchan Sparks Row Speaking to reporters outside Parliament, Ms Bachchan said: "Where is the water most contaminated right now? It is in Kumbh." Edited by: Liu Chuen Chen India News Feb 03, 2025 20:09 pm IST Published On Feb 03, 2025 19:41 pm IST Last Updated On Feb 03, 2025 20:09 pm IST Read Time: 4 mins Share Twitter WhatsApp Facebook Reddit Email Samajwadi Party MP Jaya Bachchan. New Delhi: Samajwadi Party MP Jaya Bachchan on Monday stoked controversy through her remarks that the Ganga water in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, where thousands of people are taking a dip during the ongoing Maha Kumbh, is allegedly highly contaminated as bodies of those killed in the recent stampede were dumped in the river. Ms Bachchan, a Rajya Sabha MP, dismissed the Yogi Adityanath government's claims that crores of people have participated in the Maha Kumbh, one of the largest religious gatherings in the world. She also demanded that the government provide actual figures on the deaths that took place during the stampede. A sacred event for Hindus, the Maha Kumbh began on January 13 and will conclude on February 26. On January 29, at least 30 people were killed when a huge crowd broke barricades and jostled for space to take a holy dip at the Sangam - the confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna and mythical Saraswati - during "Amrit Snan" on the occasion of Mauni Amavasya. Speaking to reporters outside Parliament, Ms Bachchan said: "Where is the water most contaminated right now? It is in Kumbh. No one is giving any clarification on that. Bodies (of those who died in the stampede) have been thrown in the river because of which the water has been contaminated... This is the water which is being used by the people there. No one is giving any clarification on this." She added: "The real issues of the country are not being addressed. People who do not get any VIP treatment, the common man, no arrangement has been made for them." Asked what it is that she was seeking from the state government, the actor-politician said: "At least tell us the truth about what happened at Kumbh. They (government) should speak about it in Parliament." #WATCH | Delhi: Samajwadi Party MP Jaya Bachchan says, "... Where is the water most contaminated right now? It's in Kumbh. Bodies (of those who died in the stampede) have been thrown in the river because

title: Exclusive! I return home from Maha Kumbh with mixed emotions, says Namish Taneja
content: Exclusive! I return home from Maha Kumbh with mixed emotions, says Namish Taneja | - The Times of India Sign In TOI Go to TOI Etimes TOI Games Delhi Elections 2025 Budget 2025 Videos City Metro Cities mumbai delhi bengaluru Hyderabad kolkata chennai Other Cities City agra agartala ahmedabad ajmer amaravati amritsar bareilly bhubaneswar bhopal chandigarh chhatrapati sambhajinagar coimbatore cuttack dehradun erode faridabad ghaziabad goa gurgaon guwahati hubballi imphal indore itanagar jaipur jammu jamshedpur jodhpur kanpur kochi kohima kolhapur kozhikode ludhiana lucknow madurai mangaluru meerut mumbai region mysuru nagpur nashik navi mumbai noida patna prayagraj puducherry pune raipur rajkot ranchi thane salem shillong shimla srinagar surat trichy thiruvananthapuram udaipur vadodara varanasi vijayawada visakhapatnam photos Web Stories India featured Maha Kumbh Mela 2025 Times Evoke Maharashtra Delhi Karnataka Tamil Nadu Telangana Uttar Pradesh West Bengal Gujarat Madhya Pradesh Bihar Chandigarh Rajasthan Arunachal Pradesh Andhra Pradesh Assam Chhattisgarh Goa Haryana Himachal Pradesh Jammu Kashmir Jharkhand Kerala Manipur Meghalaya Mizoram Nagaland Odisha Punjab Sikkim Tripura Uttarakhand Andaman Nicobar Islands Dadra Nagar Haveli Daman Diu Lakshadweep Pondicherry Web Stories Saving Our Stripes Digital Arrest World Business Tech Cricket Sports Entertainment Astro TV Web Series Life & Style Education Photos Blogs News Exclusive! I return home from Maha Kumbh with mixed emotions, says Namish Taneja Exclusive! I return home from Maha Kumbh with mixed emotions, says Namish Taneja Akash Wadhwa / TNN / Feb 5, 2025, 12:59 IST Share AA + Text Size Small Medium Large The Aye Mere Humsafar actor Namish Taneja was recently in Prayaraj to participate in the Shahi Snan at the Maha Kumbh Namish Taneja taking a holy dip in Ganga at the Sangam in Prayagraj during the ongoing Maha Kumbh Actor Namish Taneja , for whom visiting this Maha Kumbh was on top of his wish list, says he wasn’t sure if that would work out because of professional commitments. “Recently, I was almost finalized for a show and was even supposed to shoot the promo. Since actors often work around the clock, I thought I wouldn’t be able to visit the Maha Kumbh though not during the Shahi Snan. However, destiny had other plans. While the show didn’t work out, I was given the incredible opportunity to take a Shahi Snan ,” says Namish, adding, “My father was a deeply spiritual soul, and if he were alive, he would have definitely visited Prayagraj . This was more of a reason for me to go for Maha Kumbh.” Namish Taneja taking a holy dip in Ganga at the Sangam in Prayagraj during the ongoing Maha Kumbh Namish Taneja taking a holy dip in Ganga at the Sangam in Prayagraj during the ongoing Maha Kumbh Telling us about the experience at Kumbh, the Mishri actor shared. “My mother, sister and I took a flight from Mumbai to Lucknow, then travelled to Phaphamau by road. From there, we took a train to Naini Bridge. The train was overcrowded, and the doors were locked from the inside. Thankfully, with the help of two police inspectors, Ram Kishore and Amit Kumar, we managed to board. The place where the tragic stampede occurred on Mauni Amavasya was the exact spot where we had initially planned to take the holy dip. However, upon seeing the overwhelming crowd, we decided to perform our snan at another ghat. Later, we learned about the devastating incident. But overall my visit to the Maha Kumbh was overwhelming, and I return home with mixed emotions.” Namish Taneja taking a holy dip in Ganga at the Sangam in Prayagraj during the ongoing Maha Kumbh Namish also managed to spend some time in Lucknow while going back to Mumbai. “Before heading back, I visited Hazratganj to buy Lakhnawi chikan outfits for my loved ones. Then, I explored Chatori Gali to indulge in delicious food. I enjoyed the basket chaat and I must say the food in Lucknow is so incredible that I’m already craving another visit.” About the Author Akash Wadhwa Akash Wadhwa is a senior copy editor-cum-correspondent at Lucknow Times. He handles the "Lucknow Is Talking About" and "Allahabad Is Talking About" pages, and also does Bollywood and TV reporting, as well as lifestyle and local reporting from Lucknow. He is an ardent television viewer. title: PM Modi Takes Holy Dip At Maha Kumbh 2025
content: PM Modi Takes Holy Dip At Maha Kumbh 2025 PM Modi Takes Holy Dip At Maha Kumbh 2025 Producer: Bhaswati Sengupta February 5, 2025 Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited the Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj on February 5. Image: ANI/ X After reaching the fair venue, the Prime Minister took a boat ride to Triveni Sangam with Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. Image: ANI/ X PM Modi took a holy dip at Triveni Sangam, the confluence of three rivers- the Ganga, the Yamuna, and the mythical Saraswati. Image: ANI/ X The Prime Minister prayed to Maa Ganga in saffron jackets and track pants. Image: ANI/ X He chanted mantras holding ‘rudrakasha’ beads as he offered prayers standing knee-deep in the river. Image: ANI/ X PM Narendra Modi also performed Aarti at Triveni Sangam in Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh. Image: ANI/ X The Prime Minister’s visit comes on February 5, when election is underway in the national capital. Image: ANI/ X Maha Kumbh began on Paush Purnima (January 13) and is the world largest spiritual and cultural gathering. NEXT: PM Modi Takes Holy Dip At Maha Kumbh, Says ‘Snan In Sangam Is…’

title: A spiritual journey: Bhutan king explores Maha Kumbh's significance at Prayagraj; see photos
content: A spiritual journey: Bhutan king explores Maha Kumbh's significance at Prayagraj; see photos Edition IN IN US Sign In TOI City prayagraj mumbai delhi bengaluru Hyderabad kolkata chennai agra agartala ahmedabad ajmer amaravati amritsar bareilly bhubaneswar bhopal chandigarh chhatrapati sambhajinagar coimbatore cuttack dehradun erode faridabad ghaziabad goa gurgaon guwahati hubballi imphal indore itanagar jaipur jammu jamshedpur jodhpur kanpur kochi kohima kolhapur kozhikode ludhiana lucknow madurai mangaluru meerut mumbai region mysuru nagpur nashik navi mumbai noida patna puducherry pune raipur rajkot ranchi thane salem shillong shimla srinagar surat trichy thiruvananthapuram udaipur vadodara varanasi vijayawada visakhapatnam photos Web Stories Today's ePaper up elections weather News City News prayagraj News A spiritual journey: Bhutan king explores Maha Kumbh's significance at Prayagraj; see photos Trending MLA Amanatullah Khan Delhi BJP Candidates List Maha Kumbh Monalisa Bhosle Chennai Trio Sexual Assault Bengaluru Thief Arrested MLA Amanatullah Khan Delhi BJP Candidates List Maha Kumbh Monalisa Bhosle Chennai Trio Sexual Assault Bengaluru Thief Arrested MLA Amanatullah Khan Delhi BJP Candidates List Maha Kumbh Monalisa Bhosle Chennai Trio Sexual Assault Bengaluru Thief Arrested A spiritual journey: Bhutan king explores Maha Kumbh's significance at Prayagraj; see photos Updated: Feb 5, 2025, 13:18 IST Share AA + Text Size Small Medium Large Follow us 1 / 10 On PM's invitation Bhutan's King, Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck, makes a special visit to India to attend the Maha Kumbh Mela at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the MEA states. 2 / 10 Warm welcome at Bamrauli Mayor Umesh Kesarwani welcomes King Wangchuck and CM Yogi at Bamrauli airport, presenting a Sangam memento to the King of Bhutan. 3 / 10 Holy dip at Sangam Bhutan King Jigme Khesar and CM Yogi Adityanath take a sacred dip at Triveni Sangam on Tuesday, awed by the grand spiritual gathering. 4 / 10 UP governor hosts dinner During the Bhutanese King's visit, Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel hosts a dinner in his honor. 5 / 10 Offering prayers to rivers CM briefs the Bhutanese King on Maha Kumbh's significance, and together they offer prayers to the Ganga, Yamuna, and mythical Saraswati. 6 / 10 Strengthening Indo-Bhutan ties The Bhutanese King's visit strengthens cultural and diplomatic ties between the nations, attended by leaders like Satyendra Dev Singh, Nand Gopal Gupta 'Nandi', and Jagadguru Santosh Das (Satua Baba). 7 / 10 Traditional to saffron attire Upon landing at the airport in Bhutan's traditional attire, Wangchuck switches to a long saffron kurta and pyjama before stepping into the waters. 8 / 10 Bhutan King embarks on sojourn Bhutan's King, Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck, arrived in the state capital on Monday, received a warm welcome from the Chief Minister, and then traveled to Sangam City for a spiritual ritual. 9 / 10 Temple visit After the dip, the Bhutan King visits the sacred Akshayvat, a symbol of eternity in Hinduism, and Bade Hanuman Temple to offer prayers. 10 / 10 Exploring digital Maha Kumbh CM Yogi and Bhutan's King Wangchuck visit the Digital Mahakumbh Experience Centre at Maha Kumbh Mela, Prayagraj.
